SENT.plain: Extension of primary lung tumors into the left atrium via pulmonary veins is a well-documented phenomenon
Peripheral arterial embolism and cerebral embolism originating from a primary lung neoplasm are rare events

We report a case of simultaneous acute bilateral lower limb ischemia, bilateral renal infarction, splenic infarction and cerebral infarction as a result of multiple emboli originating from primary lung malignancy invasion of the left atrium
An emergent embolectomy revealed pathologic features of the extracted thrombus that were identical to the pulmonary neoplasm
